åˆ©ç”³ï¼šå€‹é¢è®€å®Œæ›¸ï¼Œå±‹ä¼éŸ¿toronto

If you can speak Cantonese and/or mandarin in addition to fluent English, it's not that hard to find a entry level job in Vancouver or Toronto, just don't expect having comparable salaries with HK.
It's always a good idea to live and work for several years to apply for citizenship before repatriation though.

P.S I am a vancouverite Canadian from HK

çœŸä¿‚long stay in Canada è©±æˆ‘çŸ¥ï¼Œå¤§å®¶æœ‰å€‹ç…§æ‡‰

It depends on what values more to you.
It's a good place to be a home town and to live a simple life, but definitely not the best place to make a lot of money.
Local adults leave the city to the east coast or Asia to make money. But they always return back here sooner or later at some point.
Three years is a short period of time, but it may give you valuable experience that may or may not benefit you living or working in HK later on
